column4: is there any software that can make my USB bootable for linux/ubuntu
I am having problem with USB to make it bootable
Depends on how you prepared the USB (stick? external HDD?) Does the BIOS support booting from USB (whatever) in the first place?
Are you trying to prepare the stick on windows side?
Cause if you are, try this link: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromUSBStick#From Windows

Please, please be more specific. What are you trying to do, what did you do that now fails, and if you're using the stick under Windows properly, it cannot have been made as a proper installation/live USB stick.
I tried to install an .iso linux on USB via UNEBootin but after instalation  nothing happens
the USB then was made bootbale with DISKPart in MSwwindow
Sounds like your system doesn't know it's supposed to boot from the USB stick, then. Try to look into the BIOS settings.
It doesn't need to be touched by anything else after the UNETbootin (or however it is spelt)
I installed UNETBootin in my Ubuntu, then I am trying to install Mint on a USB stick
Okay, what's the Windows got to do with this? You're really making my head spin now.
ok here is my Q: I have installed UNEBootin in my Ubuntu...how can I make a live Bootable USB
Okay. You need to start the application, then specify the device on which you want the image to be installed, and of course the image that _is_ to be installed.
Ubuntu will fit on that space, as it's only around 700MB
That's a Windows command, you won't need that when you can be using UNETbootin
Around 700MB, due to CD sizes.
Again, Ubuntu Live, around 700MB, due to CD size limitation.
You don't have to make it bootable, if you created it with usb-creator or unetbootin
somehow the usb fails to boot with Linux on it
Are you seeing any messages while it's trying to boot?
no....but I am trying it again with UNETbootin and Live usb Ubuntu
